dct_title_s: Net-Zero America bulk transmission expansions from spur lines to metropolitan statistical areas for reference scenario (base land use), 2050
dct_description_sm: This dataset shows the expansions to bulk electric transmission lines in the contiguous United States that will be required by 2050 to connect spur line connection points (substations that existed in 2019 and had a voltage class rating of 161kV or greater) to metropolitan statistical areas (MSAs) under a reference scenario projecting no changes in energy policy and under more permissive land-use assumptions. For an overview of this "REF" frozen-policy scenario and these "base" land-use assumptions, please refer to the "supplemental information" portion of this record.
dct_creator_sm: Andrew Pascale, Andlinger Center, Princeton University, Post-Doctoral Research Associate
